notes.text: Palo Alto Networks PSIRT provided VEX document. This document is autogenerated.
notes.title: Informational: PAN-OS BIOS and Bootloader Security Bulletin

document.title: Palo Alto Networks PSIRT provided VEX document: PAN-SA-2025-0003

revision_history.summary: Added more clarifying language and fixed Product types in CVE Table.
Clarified the Required Configuration for Exposure section.
Updated the Required Configuration for Exposure to indicate that none of the network related CVEs apply to PAN-OS.
Added clarifying language in the CVE Table.

notes.text: The BootHole vulnerability may allow an attacker to hijack and tamper the GRUB verification process. It is not possible for malicious actors or PAN-OS administrators to exploit this vulnerability under normal conditions on PAN-OS versions with up-to-date, secured management interfaces deployed according to the best practices guidelines.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: Insyde InsydeH2O Kernel do not check address of a buffer is valid. We are working with the third-party vendors to develop any firmware updates that may be needed for PA-3200 series, PA-5200 series and PA-7000 series with Switch Management Card (SMC-B) installed. All other hardware firewalls are not affected.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: Privilege escalation in InsydeH2O Kernel. We are working with the third-party vendors to develop any firmware updates that may be needed for PA-3200 series, PA-5200 series and PA-7000 series with Switch Management Card (SMC-B) installed. All other hardware firewalls are not affected.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: Memory corruption in Insyde InsydeH2O with Kernel. We are working with the third-party vendors to develop any firmware updates that may be needed for PA-3200 series, PA-5200 series and PA-7000 series with Switch Management Card (SMC-B) installed. All other hardware firewalls are not affected.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

We are working with the third-party vendors to develop any firmware updates that may be needed for PA-3200 series, PA-5200 series and PA-7000 series with Switch Management Card (SMC-B) installed. All other hardware firewalls are not affected.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: Insufficient validation of the allocated buffer pointer in IdeBusDxe in Insyde InsydeH2O with kernel. We are working with the third-party vendors to develop any firmware updates that may be needed for PA-3200 series, PA-5200 series and PA-7000 series with Switch Management Card (SMC-B) installed. All other hardware firewalls are not affected.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: Memory corruption in AhciBusDxe in Insyde InsydeH2O with kernel. We are working with the third-party vendors to develop any firmware updates that may be needed for PA-3200 series, PA-5200 series and PA-7000 series with Switch Management Card (SMC-B) installed. All other hardware firewalls are not affected.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: Also known as LogoFail, some BIOS are susceptible to malicious logo images written to the BIOSâs filesystem. PAN-OS is not affected as the conditions required to exploit this vulnerability do not exist in PAN-OS.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: An out-of-bounds write vulnerability exists in TPM2.0's Module Library allowing writing of a 2-byte data past the end. This issue is not applicable to PAN-OS.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: PixieFAIL: EDK2's Network Package is susceptible to an out-of-bounds read vulnerability when processing the IA_NA or IA_TA option in a DHCPv6 Advertise message. PAN-OS is unaffected since the BIOS network stack is disabled.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: PixieFAIL: EDK2's Network Package is susceptible to a buffer overflow vulnerability via a long server ID option in DHCPv6 client. PAN-OS is unaffected since the BIOS network stack is disabled.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: PixieFAIL: EDK2's Network Package is susceptible to an out-of-bounds read vulnerability when processing  Neighbor Discovery Redirect messages. PAN-OS is unaffected since the BIOS network stack is disabled.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: PixieFAIL: EDK2's Network Package is susceptible to an infinite loop vulnerability when parsing unknown options in the Destination Options header of IPv6. PAN-OS is unaffected since the BIOS network stack is disabled.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: PixieFAIL: EDK2's Network Package is susceptible to an infinite loop vulnerability when parsing a PadN option in the Destination Options header of IPv6. PAN-OS is unaffected since the BIOS network stack is disabled.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: PixieFAIL: EDK2's Network Package is susceptible to a buffer overflow vulnerability when processing DNS Servers option from a DHCPv6 Advertise message. PAN-OS is unaffected since the BIOS network stack is disabled.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: PixieFAIL: EDK2's Network Package is susceptible to a buffer overflow vulnerability when handling Server ID option from a DHCPv6 proxy Advertise message. PAN-OS is unaffected since the BIOS network stack is disabled.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003

notes.text: PixieFAIL: EDK2's Network Package is susceptible to a predictable TCP Initial Sequence Number. PAN-OS is unaffected since the BIOS network stack is disabled.

references.summary: Palo Alto Networks Security Advisory PAN-SA-2025-0003
